SCRIPT FOUR
WRITER: JOHN LERCH
MUSIC:
REPORT FROM JAPAN
THEME ESTABLISH (5 SECONDS) UNDER
ANNCR:
REPORT FROM JAPAN! (EMPHASIS) A Program of information and
commentary treating current issues in Japan. This program
is produced on tape recording in Tokyo. Here now is your
host, John Lerch,
MUSIC:
THEME OUT
LERCH:
We have several interesting items on our agenda today. We’re
going to take a stroll down the colorful business heart of
Tokyo known as the Ginza—the Fifth Avenue, the Champs Elysees
of Tokyo. And with our guest we’ll chat about two basic
Japanese foods: soba and udon. Soba is a buckwheat noodle;
served in a broth; udon is a flour noodle cheap^ nourishing
and, over here - indispensable. We’ll also devote time to
the International Fair at Osaka. However, let’s listen now
to HIGHLIGHTS IN THE NEWS.
MUSIC:_
-DOCUMENTARY^(NEWSREEL^:_ ESTABLISH._ UNDER
ANNCR:
HIGHLIGHTS IN THE NEWS FROM JAPAN!
MUSIC:
OUT
ANNCR:
Japan is building a huge dam at Sakuma for hydroelectric
power. This will increase power production by 5 million k.w.
LERCH:
Sakuma Dam on the Tenryu River will rise 529 feet and be 800
feet in length—the biggest in Japan, and seventh highest in
the world. It will provide not only hydroelectric power, but
irrigation and flood control—of great importance to Japan’s
agricultural economy.
ANNCR:
NHK PLANS TO INSTALL 11 MORE TV STATIONS
LERCH:
The Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK), now operating three *
television stations in Tokyo, Osaka and Nagoya, respectively^
will open 11 additional stations during the course of this
spring and summer.
